maml:description.maml:para: Azure Artifacts credentials creation
Adds the credentials required to add an Azure Artifacts feed as a repository. The credentials are stored in credential manager using the BetterCredentials module

maml:Description.maml:para: The PAT is generated within Azure DevOps. Is is best to create a new PAT with only read access to Package Management to prevent misuse of the credentials
The PAT is generated within Azure DevOps. Is is best to create a new PAT with only read access to Package Management to prevent misuse of the credentials

maml:alert.maml:para: This function also supports the -Verbose parameter to show more detailed console output

maml:description.maml:para: Registers Azure Nuget feed as a repository

Registers an Azure Package Management nuget feed to PowerShell as a repository. This uses BetterCredentials to store the repository credentials in the Windows Credential Vault to make it easier to interact with the repository

maml:Description.maml:para: This is the name you want the repository to be registered with

The username parameter is not checked when the repository is registered, however the Username is used by BetterCredentials to store the authentication information and when interacting with the repository to install modules
The PAT is generated within Azure DevOps. Is is best to create a new PAT with only read access to Package Management to prevent misuse of the credentials
This is the URL provided by Azure DevOps for using the repository
This is the name you want the repository to be registered with

The username parameter is not checked when the repository is registered, however the Username is used by BetterCredentials to store the authentication information and when interacting with the repository to install modules
The PAT is generated within Azure DevOps. Is is best to create a new PAT with only read access to Package Management to prevent misuse of the credentials
This is the URL provided by Azure DevOps for using the repository

maml:alert.maml:para: This function also supports the -Verbose parameter to show more detailed console output

maml:description.maml:para: Registers Azure Nuget feed as a repository
Registers an Azure Package Management NuGet feed to PowerShell as a repository. This uses BetterCredentials access the repository credentials stored in the Windows Credential Vault

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the repository being registered
The name of the repository being registered

maml:alert.maml:para: This function also supports the -Verbose parameter to show more detailed console output

maml:description.maml:para: Compares contents of two .txt files

This function wraps around the Compare-Object file, to display differences between two files. It forces you to supply the two files as parameters. The function currently works best on text or csv files with only one column

maml:Description.maml:para: This parameter specifies the location of the first file you want to compare
This parameter specifies the location of the second file you want to compare
This parameter specifies the location of the first file you want to compare
This parameter specifies the location of the second file you want to compare

maml:alert.maml:para: This function also supports the -Verbose parameter for more console output

maml:description.maml:para: Find module or modules in an Azure Artifacts repository
This function wraps around the Find-Module function. It uses BetterCredentials module to secure authentication to the feed and reduce installation effort

maml:Description.maml:para: This parameter specifies the name of the module you wish to find
This parameter specifies the name of the Repository that you want to search. This parameter defaults to NodePowerShell
This parameter specifies the name of the module you wish to find
This parameter specifies the name of the Repository that you want to search. This parameter defaults to NodePowerShell

maml:alert.maml:para: This function also supports the -Verbose parameter for more console output

maml:description.maml:para: Outputs the execution time of the the last command in history.

Calculates and outputs the time difference of the last command in history. The difference will be outputted in a "human" format if the Humanizer module (https://www.powershellgallery.com/packages/PowerShellHumanizer/2.0) is installed.

maml:alert.maml:para: Returns $null if the history buffer is empty. Thanks go to - https://gist.github.com/kelleyma49/bd03dfa82c37438a01b1 - for this function

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Outputs the execution time of the the last command in history.

maml:description.maml:para: Help function
This function is purely used to write general help information to the PowerShell console
Install a module from an Azure Artifacts repository
This function wraps around the Install-Module function and uses BetterCredentials to secure authentication to the feed and reduce installation effort

maml:Description.maml:para: This parameter specifies the name of the module you wish to install
This parameter specifies the name of the Repository that you want to install the module from. This parameter defaults to the value NodePowerShell
This parameter specifies the name of the module you wish to install
This parameter specifies the name of the Repository that you want to install the module from. This parameter defaults to the value NodePowerShell

maml:alert.maml:para: This function also supports the -Verbose parameter for more console output

maml:description.maml:para: Module creation function
Function to automate the creation of new PowerShell modules. The module relies on Git-Scm being installed. It also replies on the Plaster and PSGitHub modules being installed from the PSGallery

maml:Description.maml:para: The -GitHubPath parameter allows you to supply the path to your GitHub folder. If the folder does not exist, You will see an error
The -ModuleDescription parameter supplies the name of your new PowerShell module and GitHub repository
The -ModuleDescription parameter supplies the description of your new PowerShell module and GitHub repository
The -GitHubPath parameter allows you to supply the path to your GitHub folder. If the folder does not exist, You will see an error
The -ModuleDescription parameter supplies the name of your new PowerShell module and GitHub repository
The -ModuleDescription parameter supplies the description of your new PowerShell module and GitHub repository

maml:description.maml:para: Show my PowerShell Profile banner
This function is purely used to write my PowerShell profile banner when I first open PowerShell
Creates a new registry path
This function takes the supplied path and creates it in the registry

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the path that you wish to create
Specifies the path that you wish to create

maml:alert.maml:para: This function does not currently show any output

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new registry property
This function takes the supplied path, name, values and property type then creates the corresponding property in the registry

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the path that you wish to create
Specifies the name of the new property
Specifies the value of the new registry property
Specifies the PropertyType of the property the following property types are available for use:

String: Specifies a null-terminated string. Equivalent to REG_SZ. ExpandString: Specifies a null-terminated string that contains unexpanded references to environment variables that are expanded when the value is retrieved. Equivalent to REG_EXPAND_SZ. Binary: Specifies binary data in any form. Equivalent to REG_BINARY. DWord: Specifies a 32-bit binary number. Equivalent to REG_DWORD. MultiString: Specifies an array of null-terminated strings terminated by two null characters. Equivalent to REG_MULTI_SZ. Qword: Specifies a 64-bit binary number. Equivalent to REG_QWORD.
Specifies the path that you wish to create
Specifies the name of the new property
Specifies the value of the new registry property
Specifies the PropertyType of the property the following property types are available for use:

String: Specifies a null-terminated string. Equivalent to REG_SZ. ExpandString: Specifies a null-terminated string that contains unexpanded references to environment variables that are expanded when the value is retrieved. Equivalent to REG_EXPAND_SZ. Binary: Specifies binary data in any form. Equivalent to REG_BINARY. DWord: Specifies a 32-bit binary number. Equivalent to REG_DWORD. MultiString: Specifies an array of null-terminated strings terminated by two null characters. Equivalent to REG_MULTI_SZ. Qword: Specifies a 64-bit binary number. Equivalent to REG_QWORD.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function does not currently show any output

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-RegistryProperty -Path "HKLM:\SOFTWARE\NodeIT" -Name Testing -Value "This is the property value" -PropertyType String

This function wraps around TcPing supplying the-t argument to always ping non-stop and the -4 argument to always use IP V4
